useCases.title: Real-World Use Cases
useCases.subtitle: From research to enterprise automation—Browser4 handles it all

case1.title: Automated Research & Massive Data Collection
case1.description: Agents auto-search across platforms, pull prices, and monitor changes. A single Browser4 node can visit 100k ~ 200k pages per day and structure data with built-in ML, boosting research efficiency by thousands of times.
case1.example: An e-commerce team collects hundreds of thousands of product records daily and auto-builds reports to guide merchandising.

case2.title: AI-Driven Agent Automation
case2.description: Let browser agents reason, plan, and execute tasks autonomously—from filling forms to multi-step workflows—freeing humans from repetitive clicks.
case2.example: A financial team uses agents to log in, navigate dashboards, export reports, and deliver results to Slack.

case3.title: Integration with LLM Workflows
case3.description: Feed real-time web data into LLMs or RAG pipelines—agents retrieve context, screenshots, and structured results on demand.
case3.example: A customer-support bot fetches live docs and screenshots to answer user questions with up-to-date info.

case4.title: Competitive Intelligence & Market Monitoring
case4.description: Continuously track competitor pricing, product launches, and reviews. Browser4 handles scale and complexity so you focus on insights.
case4.example: A retail brand monitors thousands of SKUs across e-commerce sites in real time and triggers alerts on price changes.

case5.title: QA & Testing at Scale
case5.description: Simulate user journeys across browsers and devices. Catch regressions before customers do.
case5.example: A SaaS company runs nightly tests across 50 scenarios, ensuring every release is regression-free.

painPoints.label: Current ecosystem pain points
painPoints.bullet1: No unified app store or discovery channels
painPoints.bullet2: Lack of searchable directories to match needs
painPoints.bullet3: Fragmented publishing + distribution with no standards

snapshot.bullet3: OS-level agents take over complex flows

coevolution.title: Co-evolution

mission.title: Browser4 Mission
mission.text: The agent era is already here. Browser4 is building a fair, sustainable ecosystem where AI can make autonomous decisions and act reliably, accelerating the shift toward an agentic internet.
